newsitem.title: UK: BritGas, Hanson active in tax-related trades.
newsitem.headline: BritGas, Hanson active in tax-related trades.

text.p: Shares in British Gas Plc and Hanson Plc were heavily traded on Thursday as a series of tax-related "bed-and-breakfast" trades went through the market, dealer said.

British Gas was up 4-1/2p at 203 by 0901 GMT in volume of 60.2 million shares, also boosted by analyst recommendations on the stock and a report in the Daily Mail of continuing talk of a bid from BP or Shell.
NatWest Securities repeated a "buy" recommendation on British Gas today, after yesterday UBS repeated a "buy" rating on the stock. Analysts at NatWest were not immediately available for comment.
Hanson was up 1/4p at 79-1/2 in volume of 57.3 million.
In a bed-and-breakfast trade, an investor can realise a loss in a declining share for tax reasons.
